humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the patient has infiltrating lobular carcinoma, and the size of the largest tumor is 2.2 x 2.1 x 1.6 cm. Based on the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, and T3 tumors are more than 5 cm. Since the largest tumor size is 2.2 cm, which is more than 2 cm but less than 5 cm, the T stage is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the size of the tumor is described as a 2.2 x 2.1 x 1.6 cm mass. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 stage is assigned to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
